page.title: 12RELIGION WILLEY CHAPEL
page.content: Built in 1869 on Old Hall land, the chapel replaced an earlier chapel in Pound Lane. In 1937 Hergest chapel was dismantled and re erected alongside to accomodate the Sunday school and other community events.It is the current venue of Willey & District Women's Institute. Large teas were once provided by the farmers wives to feed the congregation between Sunday services and on other occasions. Attendence dwindling to less than 10 persons, the catering burden fell on too few people and was dropped. The 1969 centenary celebration programme shows the once considerable committment of the local community to the chapel. Residents now attend services at Lingen church and the chapel is to close in September 1985.
